sentence.text: Then Eddie said , ‘ You 'll be in the next shot so if you 'll slip into your rags we 'll … ’
She finished undoing it for him and slipped out of the dress , and as she let him raise her petticoat her eyes strayed again to the patch on the ceiling .
I must have looked embarrassed when she handed it over because they both turned their backs while I slipped my old dress off and slipped the new one on .
With rapid movements , she slipped out of the revealing dress and pulled a girlish white frock out of the wardrobe .
Becky slipped out of her dress .
Without waiting for a reply , he turned to Theda , who was slipping off his greatcoat .
He slipped off his white coat and a few minutes later he hurried from the centre .
She took a deep breath and slipped off her coat .
Michael took his cigarettes from his overcoat pocket , and then slipped the coat from his shoulders .
He slipped off the raincoat and ripped the wooden box from his chest .
She slipped out of her cotton skirt and the enormously full paper nylon petticoat she wore beneath it .
By the time he had closed the door and turned into the room she had slipped the towelling robe off her shoulders .
Then she slipped out of her robe , revealing a black lace teddy , before stepping into her dress .
She stood to slip the dress down over her hips , and pouted at him in her petticoat .
